website_summaries.verdict: An ergonomic design and adjustable length almost make up for the hard-to-remove stickers on the shaft.
pros: Offset handle centers user’s weight over the cane for stability
Lightweight, and offers push-button height adjustment
Does not loosen or rattle even after months of use
cons: Too many stickers placed directly on the cane that are hard to remove
Base isn’t sturdy enough for some users

customer_reviews.title: only 2 of them removed easily. However
customer_reviews.text: For the price, this cane delivered. There were MULTIPLE tags stuck all over the cane; only 2 of them removed easily. However, I have Goo Gone on hand in my house, so after removing as much of the paper as I could, the Goo Gone removed the rest. The company might consider replacing all those tags with a paper insert. :)
customer_reviews.author: self-employed

customer_reviews.title: Low-price but high-quality.
customer_reviews.text: Definitely worth the price, it’s basic and does exactly what it supposed to. I got this for a hip replacement and wound up using it quite a bit, absolutely worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: John Henry Haggard

customer_reviews.title: I love these canes
customer_reviews.text: No problems getting the cane. I love these canes, but I hate taking off the stickers. Plan on spending at least 20+ min with your Goo Gone (or whatever you use to remove the leftover schmutz/gluey residue) from all the customer information/bar code stickers. Good advice: Dawn liquid is very helpful. Also, once most of the residue is gone, the best final swipe is with Goo Gone on a paper towel.
customer_reviews.author: bj

customer_reviews.title: Bottom is totally worn out after 4 weeks
customer_reviews.text: I bought this cane after some orthopedic surgery. Less than 4 weeks after using it, it began sliding around which almost caused me to fall. It turns out that the bottom of it was totally worn down to a metal washer. How is it possible that this could be worn down after less than 4 weeks of use?! See photo.
customer_reviews.author: Murph

customer_reviews.title: do you want to walk around with bar codes and labels?  if yes - order this cane.
customer_reviews.text: Cane is fine - it's a black adjustable cane which is what I ordered. HOWEVER, the canes came with 4 stickers - bar code, several brand names, etc. yes - 4. Only 1 came off easily. I'm not spending any more time picking and pulling -- Mr. Husband will walk around with brands and bar codes and sorry but this gets a low rating 'cuz who wants to be branded.
customer_reviews.author: Diane Miller

customer_reviews.title: Looks Good and is Easy to Adjust
customer_reviews.text: I had a total hip replacement and went home with a walker which I despise. My home health nurse suggested I buy this particular cane. It does everything it's supposed to do. It's easy to adjust, has a handle that is easy to grip, is lightweight, and looks good. One of the reviews complained about the stickers. There are 3. When I did finally take the time to peel them off, they came right off and there was no sticky residue to contend with. I highly recommend this cane.
customer_reviews.author: Delta

customer_reviews.title: So well balanced, it stands on its own
customer_reviews.text: I do not know if every one is like this, but the one I got is so well balanced, you do not have to lean it against anything. You can just have it stand upright on its own (level ground no wind). Interesting to look at. Literally stands straight up, no help. From reading the other reviews, I expected to get a great quality cane with some annoying stickers. That is exactly what I got. The other reviews were dead accurate. But a bit of work and the stickers are off now, and I am very happy with the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Patrick Fewell

customer_reviews.title: Good, solid cane that should work for most purposes if you want something simple.
customer_reviews.text: I got this in order to have something to lean on and stabilize myself with when I was having a lot of back trouble, and spent much of my time hunched over. It works well for what I needed it for and I like it. If you want something a little more sturdy, then you might try one of those canes with the 4 feet at the bottom, rather than a "single foot" as this is. The bottom doesn't slip or anything, though.
customer_reviews.author: Snail

customer_reviews.title: Cane
customer_reviews.text: I am big guy, need the support, I have had 2 knee surgeries and going on 2 more. I am 6'1" and 280lbs, so I need something that will stand the test of time. I have been using this cane on a regular basis now for 3 months and have not had one issue, it feels sturdy and most important it bears my weight. The foam padding around the handle works great, I was getting calluses from my other cane, but not with this one. Cannot beat it for the money. Great Product!
customer_reviews.author: Fletch

customer_reviews.title: This is a light but strong, very safe and very well-made cane.
customer_reviews.text: Excellent Cane . . . This cane is light in weight. It has a solid rubber tip. It has a very comfortable handle made of firm, resilient rubber that appears to help in humid weather with sweaty hands - it doesn't slip. And it adjusts in height with a round, pop-in-the-hole metal "button," In addition, its height adjustment has a threaded, safety locking action, as well. This is a light but strong, very safe and very well-made cane.
customer_reviews.author: Frequent Amazon Buyer

customer_reviews.title: Very good cane. Physical therapy approved.
customer_reviews.text: Cane is adjustable to many different heights to be the perfect stabilizer for most people. Husband needed a good cane to progress through physical therapy from rollator toward walking independently again. His therapist totally approved this cane and it has been very helpful. I am much shorter than husband but if I ever need, it can be adjusted for my needs also. Definitely recommend.
customer_reviews.author: oxrdguru

customer_reviews.title: Great lightweight canes, I bought two, a left and a right.
customer_reviews.text: Replacing a similar cane that I got very very used over ten years ago, still good, but no longer adjustable, and set too long. Also, replacing one of two canes that I got on Amazon after ignoring the "THEY'RE WAY TOO HEAVY!" reviews, then discovering that they were/are. The much larger cane tips are also hard to find. The two canes that I got today are glorious by comparison, would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Salyers

customer_reviews.title: Does not look like a picture
customer_reviews.text: Does not look like a picture, cost much more than stated if you include the time required to remove the stickers. Includes four "permanently" attached stickers (some crooked) to cane. Difficult to remove, had to use chemical solvent. Would not buy again. Good product ruined by inattention to detail
customer_reviews.author: Steve Allard

customer_reviews.title: Great cane and the price is sweet too.
customer_reviews.text: well made product. Handle is comfortable to grip. Easy height adjustment with the push in button located to next hole. Locking ring removes any rattle that could occur between the two tubes. I haven't had it long enough to comment on the longevity of the rubber knob at the base but if used on cement rubber can only withstand so much regardless. I didn't have a problem removing the labels that many have commented on. What little sticky was left Goo-Gone removed it easily.
customer_reviews.author: Larry

customer_reviews.title: Worked for me!
customer_reviews.text: Broke my leg and got a titanium rod put in. Was weight bearing right from the hospital. I started with a walker, but the cane was much more convenient to get around with. I'm 6' and 210lbs, this was on the 2nd from highest setting, and worked great. No flexing or bending, collapsed quickly if needed.
customer_reviews.author: R. Doug

customer_reviews.title: CAN'T GO WRONG
customer_reviews.text: For some reason it took 5 days to get here and we have Amazon Prime.. If we knew this we could of went to Walmart or somewhere else and got a cane. On other hand its a wonderful cane, just the right feeling and able to hold my 250 lbs without any issues...
customer_reviews.author: Wildcattom

customer_reviews.title: The actual cane is fine. The white info stickers pasted all over the ...
customer_reviews.text: The actual cane is fine. The white info stickers pasted all over the product is not fine, its extremely annoying because they do not easily come off. I got the paper part off but the Sticky glue is allover the midsection of the cane. I gave up tying to get the glue off and finally gave up in frustration..........
customer_reviews.author: Dianna

customer_reviews.title: ... suffer from vertigo and balance disorders and this is perfect. Has been a lifesaver
customer_reviews.text: I bought this cane as I suffer from vertigo and balance disorders and this is perfect. Has been a lifesaver. I feel safer taking my dog out and just something as simple as walking around my house. There are stickers on the pole itself but that's no big deal. Best money I've spent.
customer_reviews.author: Rachel

customer_reviews.title: Sent wrong Cane
customer_reviews.text: I ordered the Medline offset Handle Cane in black and received a leopard print cane with a straight handle. My hubby was not pleased. We sent it back but didn't receive a replacement or a removal of charges on our account. I ended up ordering a cane from another company.
customer_reviews.author: Anne Berthlot

customer_reviews.title: Good Cane at a cheap price.
customer_reviews.text: I am in my mid 30's and I wanted something not so flashy but still with a modern look to it. And I think this works just fine and the price is super cheap and gets the job done. I weight 120 and I'm 5'5" so this holds my weight just fine and the handle is comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: Pyrosclaw

customer_reviews.title: Geat Cane for The Money
customer_reviews.text: This cane was exactly what I was looking for - it has a slim profile and is easily adjustable. The only negative are the three or four stickers which leave sticky goo on the cane when you remove them and have to be cleaned up with Goo Gone. In spite of this I still Highly Recommend It!
customer_reviews.author: W. Schmidt

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy
customer_reviews.text: Recent ski injury to my left knee in Vermont, great cane with adjustable length..very sturdy, like the offset- I am 5"10, 200 lbs...only gripe is the stickers that are embedded into the metal, IMHO they are meant to be permanent..oh well, the cane works great and quick delivery
customer_reviews.author: DonCee

customer_reviews.title: Solid product, great price.
customer_reviews.text: Nice and sturdy. Better looking with the black as well. No sword inside so I could take on maybe 3 ninjas tops. Really everything you need from a cane except a beeper to remind you not to leave it in a grocery cart. Still for the price it's best of the basic and not that ugly aluminum color. Throw some stickers on if need be to spice it up. Adjuster button does require to much effort to adjust but enough to know it ain't going anywhere once set.
customer_reviews.author: Virgil Molacek

customer_reviews.title: Medline cane
customer_reviews.text: I was in need of a cane do to a foot injury and decided on this one. This came on time and had a loose wrap around label which came off easy. Also has two grayish stickers which I left on (one gives weight capacity ). The height is adjustable very easy by a twist and button adjuster with several heights. Handle is a soft foam and is comfortable. I like the way the handle is shaped I am able to hang it from door knobs and counter tops if I need to stand without the cane. The color is black which I like so as not to make it stand out .
customer_reviews.author: thomas

customer_reviews.title: Freakin' stickers
customer_reviews.text: As many have mentioned there is an overabundance of stickers applied to this cane unnecessarily. I like the cane and it works well but giving it a low review since the distributor doesn't seem to take the hint that getting all those stickers off is a royal PITA EDIT...I have now used this cane for 7 weeks and the rubber foot on the bottom has already worn through. At that rate I would be replacing it more than 6 times a year. Don't but this cane as it's a POS
customer_reviews.author: Showtime

customer_reviews.title: Fairly sturdy, nice adjustable height.
customer_reviews.text: Have had 3 or 4 of these. Nice and sturdy when new. Need to be careful if you take it apart tho, it can be a little loose after re-assembly. That's been my experience anyway. Other than that, have been satisfied with them.
customer_reviews.author: cf100

customer_reviews.title: Very sturdy adjustable cane that doesn't cost an arm and a leg
customer_reviews.text: It arrived in 1 day. It was easy to adjust and beats the heck out of the walker that I had to use prior. You can even use the handle to pick up some things if you aren't near a "grabber"!
customer_reviews.author: EB

customer_reviews.title: Able to expand for a tall and heavy man!
customer_reviews.text: I use a cane to get around and like to have a extra in all the cars. This one expanded quickly by simply clicking a button. The handle has a cushion which is nice and soft. Very light weight and seems strong. I highly recommend and give it 2 thumbs up!
customer_reviews.author: DagDerNiT

customer_reviews.title: while is is a nice looking cane
customer_reviews.text: Its only OK because, while is is a nice looking cane, the adhesive residue left after removing the various labels was extremely difficult to remove. They need to put labels on with a better adhesive that makes them easy to remove with no residue.
customer_reviews.author: Eggypan

customer_reviews.title: If it says Medline—BUY IT!! They are great in all thei products for us seniors.
customer_reviews.text: This cane is really good.Straight, balanced, not too heavy—just great. By the way, Medline makes great products, always!.I also have a Medline walker which is unbelievably great.They really know how to make top quality products that stand the test of time.
customer_reviews.author: Steven A.

customer_reviews.title: Two stars say I don't like it and I don't want to say that
customer_reviews.text: Two stars say I don't like it and I don't want to say that. The handle is cheap and falls apart way to soon and the rubber foot is way sub-standard. I rectified it by putting my own handle and purchased an alternate rubber foot . I have three of them so I can always find one if you know what mean.
customer_reviews.author: MICHAEL

customer_reviews.title: Dad loves it
customer_reviews.text: My dad misplaced his old cane so I bought him this one. He loves it and never leaves the house without it. On more than 1 occasion, it has prevented him from falling.
customer_reviews.author: Orleans1971

customer_reviews.title: Well Pleased & Thank You
customer_reviews.text: We are well pleased with this Medline Offset Handle Cane in Bronze. There are many canes available out there... However, there don't seem to be so many that are "Short-Person" friendly. This cane has wonderful adjustability. Coupled with its sturdiness, it makes a great cane for mom. Now in her mid-70's, and coping with strength depleting illness, she feels, nonetheless, quite secure walking about with this cane supporting her. We are well pleased with this Medline Offset Handle Cane in Bronze. Thank you, Palms Pressed
customer_reviews.author: DFB

customer_reviews.title: Just Right
customer_reviews.text: My wife has been having a lot of back pain caused by 4th/5th vertebrae misalignment, and some days has trouble walking and staying balanced. Her physiotherapist recommended she get a cane. I ordered this one for her and it's absolutely perfect. Very sturdy, adjustable height, and a nice spongy grip on the handle. The color is a very nice soft bronze, almost with pinkish highlights, so my wife loves it and doesn't feel like she's using a "medical device", but more of an accessory.
customer_reviews.author: Niilo T.

customer_reviews.title: Works well
customer_reviews.text: Works to help with giving additional support for my husband. Unfortunately, I may need to get something that provides a little additional support. It is lightweight and easy to take with.
customer_reviews.author: P jolly

customer_reviews.title: Great for daily use
customer_reviews.text: This is my daily use cane and it is fully adjustable. I can use this to beat down the vulture-like grandmothers over crab legs and prawns at the Asian buffet in the next town over. I think my doorknob reproduction cane at $50 looks better but what do my family and friends know? They wouldn't know a classy cane if it got shoved up their backsides! Harrumph!
customer_reviews.author: The Discriminating Consumer

customer_reviews.title: Pretty good for the price
customer_reviews.text: Works great, if you want a cane that will last for years this might not be the one but I've your just recovering from a surgery or something this is fine. Its easy to adjust for height but if you are very tall you probably would need a different cane because I'm about average and I use the second to last notch. Not much weight to it, if you had to fight of an attacker with it probably wouldn't be very useful. But yeah, overall it works fine if If your recovering and don't want to spend much money.
customer_reviews.author: @TSDiamondFire

customer_reviews.title: Rock Solid
customer_reviews.text: Used this cane after my knee replacement surgery, very high quality and better than the $150 cane the hospital wants to sell you (or sell to your insurance company!). Also has the effect on other people to become very nice to you and get out of your way and hold doors open for you and call you sir, so that was an unintended benefit.
customer_reviews.author: MattEnge

customer_reviews.title: Walks like a cane, looks like a cane...It is a cane!
customer_reviews.text: Cane works like a cane should. Very economical cane with adjustable height. Don't care much for the foamy rubber type grip, but it works for now though I can see that wearing out in the future
customer_reviews.author: Good&Bad

customer_reviews.title: Good quality. My daughter used it and had no ...
customer_reviews.text: Good quality. My daughter used it and had no issues. MIL borrows it sometimes and it adjusts to her height quickly and easily. Locks up tight as long as you remember to twist the lock.
customer_reviews.author: Ken

customer_reviews.title: But supposed to hold a maximum weight of 300 pound just got will see how it is in a couple months I’m sure they’ve been tested
customer_reviews.text: What I like most is the cane is very light and the handgrip is very comfortable seems a little thin But supposed to hold a maximum weight of 300 pound just got will see how it is in a couple months I’m sure they’ve been tested
customer_reviews.author: Trish

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommend
customer_reviews.text: I had to use this briefly after my hip replacement. I found it to be very sturdy and an amazing bargain for the price. It is easily adjustable for your height and the handle is comfortable and a generous size.
customer_reviews.author: Pattyann

customer_reviews.title: Good price
customer_reviews.text: Light weight and when you drop it you can step on handle and turn it up to get the bottom of cane
customer_reviews.author: Lawrence Moore

customer_reviews.title: Need a  light weight  cane......  This  works  well..!!!
customer_reviews.text: I have Arthritis in my left hip.... so at times I need a cane I am on a fixed income.... so I am always looking for things that aren't a burden on me financially ... this cane works great .... Light weight ..... great value.......
customer_reviews.author: PEN

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful value for this product
customer_reviews.text: Very easy to work with, exactly what I was looking for, and works perfectly. Very satisfied
customer_reviews.author: Ron Hasting

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Value
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this cane to use after hip replacement surgery in December. It has multiple adjustment heights and I found the one that suited me best. The price was unbeatable especially considering I only got a few weeks use out of it before I no longer needed it. It is now in my attic hopefully to not be used again.
customer_reviews.author: Randall G. Bennett

customer_reviews.title: Nice for the price!
customer_reviews.text: Sturdy and easily adjustable. Make sure to twist the lower end for final tightening or the cane will annoyingly “click” when in use. Took me a few days to figure this out.
customer_reviews.author: Mickeyb

customer_reviews.title: Nice cane but why can't they use a different kind of label on it...
customer_reviews.text: Wasn't sure I'd like the color when I got it, butt now love it so much I ordered a black one--for special occasions (it's a little dressier). Only reason for 4 stars was that it was hard getting the adhesive label off--there is still some residue on both canes.
customer_reviews.author: Earl Johnson Jr.

customer_reviews.title: Perfect cane to go with the gout
customer_reviews.text: This cane helped me out a lot. I randomly contracted gout and needed a way to painlessly get around the house. This helped me out so much and is very stable. I would buy this same cane again but it will probably last the rest of my life.
customer_reviews.author: Kenny

customer_reviews.title: Really Works Well
customer_reviews.text: I find this cane more comfortable than others. I now have to use it all the time, day and night. This is a big deal as I'm not used to that. But I'm able to handle it. It works fine in the rain as well, no slipping or trouble. The height is easily shifted and it stays exactly where it is put. I do find it comfortable even with heavy use and recommend it as it is light & easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: A. M. MillerTop Contributor: Cooking

customer_reviews.title: Used it for my broken ankle.
customer_reviews.text: Adjustable, well constructed. My sister needs a cane as well so I bought one for her and she likes it more than what she had. The hand grip is soft and comfortable so if you have to go a long distance, it won't hurt your palm like some models do.
customer_reviews.author: Pauline

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what I expected
customer_reviews.text: The cane is sturdy, light weight and easy to handle. No big deal to put together and the price was good.
customer_reviews.author: Cherie

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: Does as expected..very lightweight. Happy with puchase and I would recommend it to others.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Really supportive
customer_reviews.text: I have to be honest with you. I bought this cane as a joke for my friend who recently turned 40. I decoupaged cartoons on it and didn't think twice about it because it was so affordable. It turns out this cane is no joke. A woman at work needed to use the cane because she had hurt herself and needed a little extra support getting around one day. That cane was a trooper. If I have a family member or friend that needs a real cane for real problems, this is the cane I'll purchase again. It is very supportive and comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: toomuchamazon

customer_reviews.title: A SOLID SAFE CANE FOR YOUNG AND OLD
customer_reviews.text: Used this metal walking cane pre operation for a complete hip replacement and after 4 weeks post OP put it away in the closet for future use. It is solid, adjustible, and well made.
customer_reviews.author: Gerald W. Mattos

customer_reviews.title: Great Value!
customer_reviews.text: After reviewing canes on a LOT of other sites, I thought "Why don't I check Amazon and see what they have?" Great idea, because I saw this cane for this ridiculously low price. When it arrived, it was the EXACT cane my physical therapist recommended to me at rehab. It is lightweight, sturdy, does the job and is actually kind of pretty, with the bronze color. I have recommended this cane to other people, and they have been pleased as well. Order it. You won't be sorry. Even if you are, it's only $12.
customer_reviews.author: music lover

customer_reviews.title: Foam Handle Split
customer_reviews.text: The foam handle split in half in the first week. If you are over 200 pounds or unable to accomodate 50 percent of your body weight then this cane is probably not stable enough for you. Otherwise fine.
customer_reviews.author: J. R.

customer_reviews.title: Great adjustable cane
customer_reviews.text: Great support device. Too many labels to remove the cane is a good value and I am glad I bought it.
customer_reviews.author: Linda N

customer_reviews.title: Medline Offset Handle Cane
customer_reviews.text: This was just what I expected for the price. It is lightweight, easy to adjust and will fit my need for "short term" assistance. It took me about 5 minutes to remove the tags applied to the cane. The handle is padded to assist your grip.
customer_reviews.author: Phillip E.

customer_reviews.title: This is a very nice utility cane we bought for my husband who needs ...
customer_reviews.text: This is a very nice utility cane we bought for my husband who needs one for his balance. He already had a cane but kept misplacing it so we bought a second one. At this point I'm thinking I might need to take one of them for my own use one of these days. Or buy another one of these. They adjust easily to the height needed and are light weight and easy to carry.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: ... replacement surgery and this was an inexpensive yet very sturdy and adjustable cane
customer_reviews.text: Had hip replacement surgery and this was an inexpensive yet very sturdy and adjustable cane. I like it very much and the handle shape.
customer_reviews.author: cathy k

customer_reviews.title: Ajustable
customer_reviews.text: Husband is 6 ft 4 in and that fits him fine..any taller and it wouldn’t be ok.
customer_reviews.author: Annie Oakley

customer_reviews.title: The nuisance stickers sell there.
customer_reviews.text: Excellent cane with good price. However, in spite of many complaints the hard to remove stickers are still there!
customer_reviews.author: GVK

customer_reviews.title: Great cane for a an amazing price!
customer_reviews.text: I am a little person and I was looking for a sturdy cane that would adjust to a low enough height, and this cane is more than what I wanted!
customer_reviews.author: Devin M

customer_reviews.title: Broken tip under 2 months
customer_reviews.text: I'm being using the cane for under 2 months most of the time inside my house and the tip is already gone. Not a happy customer
customer_reviews.author: JR

customer_reviews.title: ... the first time but I already feel much more comfortable and secure walking - especially with the crazy
customer_reviews.text: took me couple days to get used to using a cane for the first time but I already feel much more comfortable and secure walking - especially with the crazy, windy storms this week! Amazing price.
customer_reviews.author: Deborah Pigfish

customer_reviews.title: Medline Offset Handle Cane, Black
customer_reviews.text: Medline Offset Handle Cane Black; I have 2 of these and sent one to my Mother. I have replaced the tips on them too. One thing most people don't think of when they buy canes is if you really need a cane is the handle has to be flat to put your weight on it. I like the lanyard and have grabbed the cane before it falls over by it plenty of times. I don't like to have them around my arms but that's just me.
customer_reviews.author: Teddy Bear's Mom

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: Do not hesitate to buy this product! The handle is extremely comfortable and the support it gives is second to none. I had bought others and could not find the right type of cane that would be comfortable and yet support me. For the price you cannot go wrong!
customer_reviews.author: Mary Herbert

customer_reviews.title: Nice and sturdy
customer_reviews.text: No complaints...easily adjustable, very sturdy. Just what I needed for recovery from knee replacement.
customer_reviews.author: JRich

customer_reviews.title: sturdy, tasteful, functional, reasonably priced
customer_reviews.text: My perfect Aid for recovery from hip replacement surgery... Comfortable to use... Lightweight... Tasteful looking... And quite reasonably priced... Loved it... That's how Coco see's it.
customer_reviews.author: coco bedokian

customer_reviews.title: Lean on me
customer_reviews.text: Cane does the trick especially for a good price. if you need more stability look into the multi-leg cane.
customer_reviews.author: Nick Jones

customer_reviews.title: TOO SMALL
customer_reviews.text: The cane was not as long as the website said, which makes it useless unless I shrink. Otherwise, it's light and easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: Russian Curmudgeon

customer_reviews.title: Serves the purpose well
customer_reviews.text: Sturdy and lightweight. Works well, as expected. Stickers are hard to remove, as others have noted. Goo Gone works well to remove glue residue.
customer_reviews.author: H. L. B.

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Easy to adjust the height, comfortable grip and light weight.
customer_reviews.author: Dennis

customer_reviews.title: adjustable height
customer_reviews.text: Wife suffering from Parkinson's and a recent stroke, but is fast recovering her ability to walk via physical therapy. She finds this cane vary helpful for walking and balance, sometimes in unison with a gait belt.
customer_reviews.author: William

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy and light
customer_reviews.text: This cane works great as an aid for my wife who is looking at knee surgery soon. It is functional and easy to use. Now if she can only remember to keep it with her.
customer_reviews.author: Tim

customer_reviews.title: Cane With Much to Offer
customer_reviews.text: An easy to use cane thanks to its ability to adjust and its long easy to grip handle. Is quite good for standing support..
customer_reviews.author: willwrite

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable cushioned handle.
customer_reviews.text: Nice cushioned handle. I bought this to replace a rubber handled cane.
customer_reviews.author: APaesan

customer_reviews.title: Good cane!
customer_reviews.text: Good cane at a good price. I have two, one for a backup.
customer_reviews.author: Al Barras

customer_reviews.title: great purchase at a great price
customer_reviews.text: very impressed by the quality of this item. i am a bigger guy and have no problem with the sturdiness of this cane. great purchase at a great price
customer_reviews.author: Ratings R Us

customer_reviews.title: Aforadable, fast delivery.
customer_reviews.text: Nice sturdy cane, like that's adjustable, comfortable hand grip, and great value 11.79$ or so.
customer_reviews.author: Clint

customer_reviews.title: Best Value
customer_reviews.text: The best value for a top notch cane. Better and cheaper than anything Walgreens has to offer. Prompt delivery and just as described. I would highly recommend this product to anyone who needs this support.
customer_reviews.author: Ronald Gorski

customer_reviews.title: Good, strong cane
customer_reviews.text: This cane has helped a lot as I recover from a lumbar disk/sciatic nerve issue. Adjustable and strong.
customer_reviews.author: RSvK

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: This cane is very suitable for my needs following total hip replacement. Thank you for the prompt delivery.
customer_reviews.author: W.V.H.

customer_reviews.title: Solid, strong, lightweight
customer_reviews.text: Got this for a family member. Awesome cane, fully adjustable, comfortable to use, very strong and steady. Also pretty lightweight.Can't beat the price.
customer_reviews.author: Tiffany

customer_reviews.title: Helps me walk
customer_reviews.text: This is helping me able to walk because of a back injury. I live how I can adjust it.
customer_reviews.author: Erin

customer_reviews.title: Appears sturdy. Very happy with purchase
customer_reviews.text: Purchased for a relative. Appears sturdy. Very happy with purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Aurora

customer_reviews.title: Good cane for the money
customer_reviews.text: I could have paid more for a cane. I could have gotten a cane I did not like. But what happened was that I got a good serviceable cane for less money than any of the competing places I checked out. Not fancy, just a good product at a very good price. Now if I can just get back to where I no longer need a cane then everything will be just perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Theodore Russell Moore

customer_reviews.title: Got this after my gallbladder was removed.
customer_reviews.text: Got this after my gallbladder was removed. Makes things so much easier since I get weak and sore and I would preferred not to face plant at a Starbucks
customer_reviews.author: Ash Sin

customer_reviews.title: Exactly As Described and Well Made
customer_reviews.text: Exactly as described and the strap is a more flexible improvement from my last metal cane. Very happy.
customer_reviews.author: James Milson

customer_reviews.title: We're you put it
customer_reviews.text: Had my hip replacement 6 3 19 it a life saver
customer_reviews.author: Donnie carlisle

customer_reviews.title: FANTASTIC PRICE !
customer_reviews.text: MY FAVORITE CANE AT A FANTASTIC PRICE, EXACTLY WHAT I WANTED WITH A NICE "SOFT" GRIP - PERFECT - THANK YOU !
customer_reviews.author: Aries1

customer_reviews.title: Rated to 300 pounds
customer_reviews.text: Good value. Rated to 300 pounds. Nice balance and weight with good finish. Sturdy feel with generous tip.
customer_reviews.author: Phyllis Schmidt

customer_reviews.title: Good sturdy cane, price is so reasonable.
customer_reviews.text: Hey I know it's just a cane, but it has been a lifesaver. Works as expected
customer_reviews.author: Deb

customer_reviews.title: Hard to Get Tip Off.
customer_reviews.text: These are great but we are unable to get the top off when it wears out. It's like buying a recycle cane.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: A Great Buy
customer_reviews.text: What does one say about a cane? This one gives me the stability I need and the confidence that I can get where I need to go. It is light, it's sturdy, and the offset handle makes it comfortable to lean on. I am extremely pleased with this cane and I would recommend it wholeheartedly.
customer_reviews.author: unclesolo1

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this for my 85 year old Aunt on the recommendation of her physical therapist. She feels confident walking around the neighborhood with it.
customer_reviews.author: Lauren M. Taylor

customer_reviews.title: Comes with multiple hard to peel stickers... Cheap
customer_reviews.text: The product arrived with 7 hard to peel stickers (bar codes). The kind of cheap stickers that leaves sticky marks and tips into small pieces and you'll need to use your nails to pick at it. Kind of an annoyance...
customer_reviews.author: Jacques

customer_reviews.title: loose tip
customer_reviews.text: A nice, light, comfortable cane but the tip was loose and got lost within a week.
customer_reviews.author: plevee

customer_reviews.title: Strong and safe cane
customer_reviews.text: Great cane. Love the product and the color. Thank you
customer_reviews.author: Joan sheehan

product_meta.title: Medline Offset Handle Cane, Black
product_meta.description: Color:BlackYou'll welcome the non-institutional look of our canes and appreciate the fact that their attractive finishes resist marring and scratching to provide years of good looks and dependable performance.
feature_bullets: Offset handle design centers the user’s weight over the strongest part of the cane
Ergonomically designed to provide comfort and support for partial weight-bearing users
Push-button, height-adjustable to find the perfect height
Secured with a locking ring to provide quiet, rattle-free use and added safety

Offset handle design centers the user’s weight over the strongest part of the cane^Ergonomically designed to provide comfort and support for partial weight-bearing users^Push-button, height-adjustable to find the perfect height^Secured with a locking ring to provide quiet, rattle-free use and added safety^250-lb. (113 kg) weight capacity
